data.title: Brooks School: Coeducational Private School in North Andover, MA
data.meta_description: Competency-Based Education - Brooks School provides a co-educational, college preparatory program for 370 students in grades 9 through 12.
data.text:
The student can generate, develop, organize, and convey original ideas orally, using language, presentation skills, and/or other media (for example, digital texts, images, and graphs) to present those ideas clearly, confidently, and in a manner appropriate to different audiences.

The student recognizes they are part of a learning community, from which they seek help and to which they contribute by using their voice, knowledge, motivation, and ability to make choices to further their own learning and the learning of those around them. The student takes responsibility for managing their own learning by engaging fully with the learning process, setting goals and steps to meet those goals, and reflecting on their work with the aim of improving future work. The student engages in all areas of the community with an aim to connect with their own passions.

The student recognizes that social justice responsibility is both an ongoing process and a goal, and understands the definitions and implications of systems of power, intersectional identities, and intercultural awareness. In their journey towards becoming an active change agent, the student understands how their actions impact various communities and advances equity, inclusion, and belonging for all.
